utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Could you tell me what brought you in today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, you know I've been having this chest pain for the since last night. Um, and I'm also having a hard time breathing so thought I should check it out.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, um and so the chest pain came on last night. Were you doing anything before before it coming on?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I was just about to head to bed and suddenly I felt this crampy pain in my chest.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and where is this pain located?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'd say like the center of my chest.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, uh, has the pain been going on constantly since last night?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I would say so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, has it changed in character at all? You said it was crampy, but has it felt like anything else?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no. Just just crampy, yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, did you feel the pain anywhere else, or do you feel it just in the center of your chest?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ah yes, center of my chest going up to around my throat area maybe.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, I see and anything that you've done, that's made the pain worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I guess taking in a deep breath.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and how about changing positions, does the pain get worse if you lie flat or or if you lean forward?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, um, and have you ever had a pain like this in your chest before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and and has the pain get been getting worse, getting better, staying the same?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, have you taken anything for it, to help with the pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and the shortness of breath you mentioned, uh, when did that start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Around the same time.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok and, is this trouble breathing like after walking a certain distance or exerting yourself?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it it it, it's just always there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and have you noticed any changes to the sounds of your breathing, like a wheeze or whistling sound?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, maybe maybe a slight wheeze.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, do you think that you're breathing more quickly?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok um, have you had a cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No cough, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and so you haven't been bringing up any sputum or or any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok and, have you had a sore throat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No sore throat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so you've had this chest pain since last night and shortness of breath that started around a similar time last night. Have you had any other symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Just just some fatigue, some tiredness.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and did that start around the same time?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: That started a few days before, like maybe two days before.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, has there been any change to your sleep or any stressful events happen that might be tiring you out?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and have you had any headaches?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope, no headaches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any eye symptoms like discharge or or eye pain?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any any redness of your eye?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, so have you had a runny nose?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and uh have you felt like your heart is racing at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, have you had a loss of taste or smell?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And have you had a decrease in your appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see, ok and have you had any changes to your weight in the last several months?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and, have you had any diarrhea or constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and how about any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh, none.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Any abdominal pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and how about any confusion or or concerns around memory?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and, any muscle aches or pains?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Maybe slight muscle aches.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had any weakness?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and any rashes you noticed anywhere?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No none.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and have you had a fever?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, nope.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: How about any any chills?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No chills.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright and then any night sweats?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and do you have any medical conditions that you see a physician regularly for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, actually sorry, I have diabetes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, is that type 2?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Type 2.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and are you taking any medications for that or is it kind of diet or lifestyle controlled?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm on insulin for that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and you use a sliding scale or do you have a regimen you use?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, I have, so I have like a long acting and short acting, so I just take the long acting before I go to bed and then the short acting before meals.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see ok. So that sounds like a great, a great plan. Do you take any other medications?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I take some vitamins and you know, like vitamin D and calcium, but that's it.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, any allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm allergic to penicillin.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, have you had antibiotics recently for any reason?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and are your immunizations up to date?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I think so. I think the only thing is I have to see if I'm up to date with my Pneumovax.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, great yeah I was wondering about that one so we can look into that certainly. And do you know if you've had the Zoster or the Shingles vaccine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes, I had that one.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok great um, and um next could you I was wondering if you could tell me a little bit about your living situation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure, I live with my husband. We live in a 3 bedroom townhouse. It's a fairly new home.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, great. Did you recently move there?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yes we did.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, cool. And so there's no concerns with like old carpets or being exposed to kind of like dust or or molds or anything like that in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and um, has your husband been sick at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, he's been fine.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and do you have any pets in the home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: We have a cat.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you have any allergies to pets?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, um and how do you support yourself financially right now?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Um, we're both retired, but we have our RESP savings.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh excellent, ok, and for your previous occupation, were you exposed to any chemicals or like asbestos or inhalants that you're aware of?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and you smoke cigarettes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink alcohol?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have maybe a glass or two glasses of wine over the weekends.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok, and do you smoke marijuana or use any cannabis products?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I don't.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how about the use of any other recreational drugs?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, no, nothing like that.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok and, and has anybody in your family had a heart condition before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My mother passed away when she was 80, she had some valvular issues.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok um, uh, ok, and has anybody in the family had a heart attack before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, not that I know of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and, anybody have any lung conditions?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Alright, and then any cancer that runs in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Cancer? No no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok um, I think that's all I wanted to cover on the the history today. Was there anything else you'd like to tell me that I was, that I maybe didn't ask about?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uh no, I think you asked me all those other questions, I'm just wondering what do you like, what do you think I have?

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, certainly, uh, so it could possibly be something related to the heart. I don't, and sometimes especially people in your age group who have diabetes can have chest pain and symptoms that could be nonspecific. And so we will, we will check that for sure. We'll get an ECG and some lab work with the troponin and also a chest X Ray so that we can investigate for that. And also the chest X Ray could help us look to see if you have something going on in your lungs, like a possible pneumonia or, maybe a viral infection as well, which could include something like COVID-19. So we'll be ordering a PCR nasal swab as well to test for that. And so in the meantime, because we'll be doing that test, it requires self quarantine for 14 days so, if possible, that would mean distancing from your husband in the home as well for that 14 day period, but the results should come back from that test within the next several days. And and sorry, also if it is positive, we will have to notify public health as well so that the appropriate contact tracing can be done.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Ok, ok well thank you very much.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Now you're very welcome. We'll get the investigations started now.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
